a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Malaria prevalence vs. GDP per capita, 2021

Malaria prevalence is the share of the population with malaria at any given time. This rate is
age-standardized
assuming a constant population structure over time and between countries. GDP per capita is adjusted for
inflation and for differences in living costs between countries.

Share of the population with malaria
(cases per 100 people)
Data source: IHME, Global Burden of Disease (2024); Eurostat, OECD, and World Bank (2025)

Note: GDP per capita is expressed in
international-$
at 2021 prices.
